intro: Collomia linearis, commonly known as the slender phlox, is a flowering plant native to western North America. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. Its linear leaves and pale purple to pink flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Collomia linearis is often found in USDA hardiness zones 4 through 9, making it adaptable to a variety of climates.
